number of helpful: 18 of 35 people (51%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
er 20, 2016
												Came back after many years, found a world where everything was teleporting and rubber-banding about.  I'd shoot at enemies and they'd vanish, so I'd try to walk away, only to find a few seconds later I would be zapped over to some new location and locked in melee with that foe - who was still standing fifty feet away in another direction, but we were in melee anyway.Also I discovered that I could now walk through walls.  This seemed awesome at first until I tried to go back into town but realized that I couldn't, because instead of climbing stairs I just kept walking through them instead.  At no point during this experiment did I ever see another actual human player.As for the parts that did still work... well, it was never impressive to begin with.  The entire MMO industry has degraded itself into little more than a machine to produce WoW clones, and this game is no exception.  The graphics may change and maybe, just maybe, some games will add a whole third faction (this one does not), but in the end it's all the same tropes, the same combat, the same classes, the same mounts, the same grind and the same empty, meaningless themepark ride for a world full of "chosen ones" that only exists to be a barrier between the new player and the max level guild/clan raiding gang - the "whales" of the industry who can always be counted on to trade in their college fund for a one point PvP advantage that only lasts until the next DLC/expansion pack comes out.In other words, if you've played any three other fantasy MMOs in your lifetime then you've already played RIFT, or at least you may as well have.  You've already seen everything that you'd see in this game.  If you still want to put yourself through this year's re-skinning of that same game then have fun with that, but to me it doesn't matter what kind of sauce you put on tofu - it's still just tofu.Now you may not agree with this but again, not one other human player this time around and honestly, I never saw more than half a dozen outside of the towns even when the game was brand new.  So don't just take my word on it - look around.  Forget the zombie survival games, this is your real "Last Man on Earth" experience right here.So considering all of this and the general state of the game I'm not the least bit surprised by their new big push to sell an expansion pack (you know, those things that most other MMOs give away for free?).  Well of course they're trying to get everyone to buy a $40DLC.  That last cash influx will make for nice golden little parachute for the company executives  who are probably laughing all the way to their banks in Switzerland before pulling the life support on this vegetable and heading off to the magical realm of comfy retirement.

												Rift was my third true MMO love. I played WoW from launch till BC, I played LOTRO from pre-order to Lorochel and then I played Rift. I loved Rift. Rift isn't what I loved. It's now a microtransaction riddled face-roll spamfest. If RIft ever want back in time Id give it a solid 8/10 but today I'd have to give it a 2/10 because there's no challenege, no fun.For instance, I logged in after not playing since right atfer the first expansion, so that's 2 years? I decided to see how the game was with my wife who always played with me. We logged-in to our lvl 50 characters ahd queed up for a new 'hard mode' dungeon so we could gauge the gameplay. We found a group rather quickly with me queing as a Tank and Her a Healer.  I was unable to locate my shield for whatever reason it was just nowhere to be found. I'm thinking we're going to be screwed, hopefully the group doesn't realize I'm tanking without a shield and kick me. Maybe a shield will drop before anyone notices. :P We're killing everything so ridiculously easily that we're pulling entire rooms and she's barely even playing. SHe goes AFK halfway through the dungeon and we easily complete it without her... Pathetic.

r 4, 2015
												If you want a really good review I would head over to mmo-grinder and check out the 40 min episode that goes over in detail the qualities, innovations, and ideologies of the game for better or worse. There is a lot of good in the game and it's faults are nothing dramatic. The bag space issue for f2p accounts can be pretty obnoxious but considering some of the greed machines out there like swotor, and omfg evolve (I know it's not an mmo but freaking for real) they set a pretty good baseline for thier business mod.The games best innovation is really based around their soul system (talents, traits, or whatever) that really allow you to customize your playstyle to where your almost designing your own class. Min-maxer nazi's will abound but the options to work outside a cookie build are really pretty amazing.Please understand that though steam lists me as 40+ hours I am probably closer to 1000 as I only recently began using steam to handle the game.

content:
er 23, 2016
												RIFT!!! Everyone then scrambles to get themselves together , mounting and running across maps and get in on the kills of creatures breaking forth from a portal busting/tearing through reality for epic loot and rewards. Thats this game. A RPG MMO with a style and theme that runs with a very in depth fantastic storyline. The world of Telara is pretty much in ruin by a bad guy sorceror evil evil guy. His names Regulas, charismatic with followers and evil evilness. No one can seem to defeat him and the 2 factions Defiant and Guardains are just as much at war with each other as with Regulas. So with crazy ancient technology that is very artistic and themed throughout this game. Kinda reminds me of Stargate SG-1 stuff, create the ascended with souls and this crazy technology steampunk stuff. Thats you, an ascended and off to character creation and off to the story line of grooming yourself to go back in time to kill Regulas for your faction and save Telara. YAY. Factions of Guardians ( chosen of the gods) or Defiants ( we got this bro) is more of race selection. Guardians have humans, elfs and dwarfs. Defiants have humans, elfs and bahmi. Bahmi are the games created race and seem orcish spiritual brutes. So with that there is classes-Warrior, cleric , mage, rogue. SIMPLE? no. this is where RIFT brings more to the custimizable table. True you have a class, but for each class you choose 3 soul trees out of a large list of souls. Each souls tree brings a very specific playing style, abilities, skills. So mix/match what you want to do as your chosen class with 3 soul trees. There are lots of souls, you can change the souls according to role or gear or w/e AT ANY POINT OF THE GAME. You can definantly be so custimizable with your class its nuts. Its fun. Warrior that has a warrior pet? yes. Rogue with a bow that heals? yes. So with the possibilities endless and the freedom to do it. DO IT. Thus then you play the game, like I said going back in time to prep yourself for the coming battle against Regulas for honor of your faction.  Aspects of the game of equipment and class upgrading is typical of RPGMMOs. Points and better gear and abilities and such while leveling doing quests/missions and grinding. Crafting is about the same of choose what fits your class or what you want to do and do as follows to get better. Armorcrafting, runecrafting, outfitting and such. Fishing and survivialism everyone has and starts off with . They are nice ''food eating health buffs'' and time killing crafting. Higher levels is higher rewards, but harder to craft. Fun and rewarding.  This game has 2 neat little aspects of minnions and demensions. Minnions are little creatures that you collect and send off to do quests to gather stuff ( crafting stuff) for you and level up and Dimensions are little homemade houses and areas you collect decor on  and make your own. These have become the new standerd of RPGMMOs, Rift does fill that void and does a good job implementing their own style and theme into it.  oh and yes, .... RIFTS?! are little portal/tears in reality that element specific creatures do spawn out of, and show up randomly, accessable to anybody and when shut down through waves/stages you get epic gear and loot. trust me, you want in on them whenever/whereever possible. its the game. its fun. RIIIIIFFFFT!!!!!

content:
, 2014
												The few hours I spent playing this game were painstaking. There was absolutely no redeeming factor to the fact that the combat was bland and there was nothing fun about this game. The first class I picked, some sort of stealthy assassin rogue-like class, was apparently so underpowered that it was completely unplayable. It took me 15 minutes to find a friendly player to tell me that that class is practically unplayable because you can't even kill the beginning monsters. I had thought I was doing something wrong. Apparently, the interesting classes need someone to heal them 24/7 and their attacks are weak. The rest of the classes, as far as I could tell, were the generic Warrior/Mage, etc. classes.  Already off to a rough start, I find out there is a subscription (ugh, what is this, Club Penguin?) and that there are also microtransactions and starter packs between $40 and $150.Quite honestly, this game could easily be worse than most RPGs. It's unbalanced classes, money-eating methods, and absolutely NO exciting things about the game leave it to be just another generic piece of crap designed to eat your money. I know this may sound a bit extreme, but without anything to redeem this game from all the bad stuff, what can be said to be good about it?If you're looking for an RPG, try anything but this. Now that I think about it, I think I found more good things in Bad Rats than I did in this game.2/10, generic RPG, don't waste your time

content:
er 23, 2016
												RIFT!!! Everyone then scrambles to get themselves together , mounting and running across maps and get in on the kills of creatures breaking forth from a portal busting/tearing through reality for epic loot and rewards. Thats this game. A RPG MMO with a style and theme that runs with a very in depth fantastic storyline. The world of Telara is pretty much in ruin by a bad guy sorceror evil evil guy. His names Regulas, charismatic with followers and evil evilness. No one can seem to defeat him and the 2 factions Defiant and Guardains are just as much at war with each other as with Regulas. So with crazy ancient technology that is very artistic and themed throughout this game. Kinda reminds me of Stargate SG-1 stuff, create the ascended with souls and this crazy technology steampunk stuff. Thats you, an ascended and off to character creation and off to the story line of grooming yourself to go back in time to kill Regulas for your faction and save Telara. YAY. Factions of Guardians ( chosen of the gods) or Defiants ( we got this bro) is more of race selection. Guardians have humans, elfs and dwarfs. Defiants have humans, elfs and bahmi. Bahmi are the games created race and seem orcish spiritual brutes. So with that there is classes-Warrior, cleric , mage, rogue. SIMPLE? no. this is where RIFT brings more to the custimizable table. True you have a class, but for each class you choose 3 soul trees out of a large list of souls. Each souls tree brings a very specific playing style, abilities, skills. So mix/match what you want to do as your chosen class with 3 soul trees. There are lots of souls, you can change the souls according to role or gear or w/e AT ANY POINT OF THE GAME. You can definantly be so custimizable with your class its nuts. Its fun. Warrior that has a warrior pet? yes. Rogue with a bow that heals? yes. So with the possibilities endless and the freedom to do it. DO IT. Thus then you play the game, like I said going back in time to prep yourself for the coming battle against Regulas for honor of your faction.  Aspects of the game of equipment and class upgrading is typical of RPGMMOs. Points and better gear and abilities and such while leveling doing quests/missions and grinding. Crafting is about the same of choose what fits your class or what you want to do and do as follows to get better. Armorcrafting, runecrafting, outfitting and such. Fishing and survivialism everyone has and starts off with . They are nice ''food eating health buffs'' and time killing crafting. Higher levels is higher rewards, but harder to craft. Fun and rewarding.  This game has 2 neat little aspects of minnions and demensions. Minnions are little creatures that you collect and send off to do quests to gather stuff ( crafting stuff) for you and level up and Dimensions are little homemade houses and areas you collect decor on  and make your own. These have become the new standerd of RPGMMOs, Rift does fill that void and does a good job implementing their own style and theme into it.  oh and yes, .... RIFTS?! are little portal/tears in reality that element specific creatures do spawn out of, and show up randomly, accessable to anybody and when shut down through waves/stages you get epic gear and loot. trust me, you want in on them whenever/whereever possible. its the game. its fun. RIIIIIFFFFT!!!!!

content:
, 2015
												Edit: I'm not quite sure who the target market for this game is. MOBAs in general have much more lively and balanced pvp matches. And they are f2p as well. Raiding in general is a laggy low-fps jerkfest. My hardware isn't the top of the line, but it handled GTA5 at a decent detail level and framerate. Maybe people who like terrain puzzles and hunting artifacts? Maybe that's the real target market of this game still? Maybe the 5mans? Except that you'll be waiting for a 5man queue to pop maybe once an hour? The scintillating general chat?Edit: The other thing that annoys me is how the expac souls are engineered to be so much better than the vanilla souls, so that you'll be forced to buy and play the new soul packs. So, if you are say, a mage, you will be forced to play harbinger, whether you want to or not, just because it does the required amount of dps needed to pass the content. Just one example of how f2p ruins a game over time. Another gripe would be how pvp rarely ever feels balanced, where almost every match feels like you're stomping the other team or you're getting stomped on. It's rare you see comebacks or even close scores at the end. It wouldn't matter except that they merged pvp and pve gear together, so that any change in pvp now affects pve, and if there's one thing pvp is always lobbying for, it's change, change, change.Edit: The thing that really annoys me about this game is the lag. I'm sure that other MMOs do trickery to mask the underlying network latency, and perhaps Trion should look into that. That and the annoying little bugs related to the UI and display that have been in the game since launch. Their QA isn't nearly up to the level that Blizzard's is. And instead of fixing the bugs, Trion seems more interested in rolling out game after game after game. With probably the same sort of bugs in them too.Edit: Not really pay to win, unless you're willing to shell out $100s. I'm guessing like all freemium models, they're relying on a few big whales to fund the playtime for everyone else. The current level cap 5man experts are decently hard. I can see where they tried to require teamwork, but all it has really done is make the tank shoulder an unequal burden in a PUG. Hence, players willing to tank are rather rare and you will be sitting in an expert queue for quite a while. The entry level raids are also decently hard too and do require even more teamwork to pull off. All in all, if you refrain from being a whale, it's a decent amount of content for not much money. PvP is rather laggy, if you ask me. I asked other people whether this sort of lag was normal and they said yes. So if you like crisp clear PvP, be prepared to be a little bit disappointed.I played this game when it first came out. At the time, it was quite challenging, the 5man experts required quite a bit of teamwork to pull off properly. I left it when it was still hard, and still a subscription game, mainly because the internet I had sucked at the time. Can't really heal when you're lagging 5000ms. Not really fun either.I decided to revisit it again, seeing as it's now f2p and subscriptionless, just to see what it's like these days. Everything is now easy mode, you're only in danger of dying if you get out of range of the healer. Otherwise the mobs just die in front of you and give you that sweet XP. The world is also ridiculously easy too, they've set the aggro radius on most mobs to be quite small, it's fairly easy to saunter in somewhere, hit a quest and then saunter back out.I'm disturbed by the fact that you can now buy purple gear at the level cap. It may be a tier behind and the current tier you may have to play for, but it looks a lot like pay to win. I've no objection to paying for things, and in some ways, f2p makes for a nicer experience. Because nobody's on the clock (either you or the game designers) you don't feel that urgent need to zip through the levels to get to the cap, so you can get on with raiding. And the game designers (who you're really playing against) don't feel that need to slow you down, so they can get more money out of you. Time is money. You want to move fast, they want you to move slow.But paying to win goes a bit too far. I haven't reached 65 yet (only 55 now), so we'll see.Everybody (if you're willing to pay for it) can now do every role. Mages, can literally tank. Yes literally. The mage tank is no longer a joke. Warriors, can heal. No, not with bandages. They really can heal.But if you just want something to kill time with, and all you care about is questing and 5mans, there's a lot of free content they're just giving away. Even if all you do is just dps with one of the original soul combos, it'll probably take you at least a month to get to 65. And then you can just move on to something else :P

content:
, 2015
												This is a pretty good MMO. It's free, but I would totally pay money to have it. There are a few microtransactions in it, but they aren't necessary to have fun in the game. They're actually pretty pointless, but I guess they have to make money some how. The basis of this game is all about rifts (how the title of the game originated). There are MMO-typical quests throughout, but there are also rifts which are tears into other dimensions. These rifts produce monsters, and you must fight them off to seal the rift. There are many types of rifts, from fire to water to earth to air, and many others I didn't mention. Several mobs appear which you have to fight off (sometimes alone, sometimes with friends). There are different stages within a rift. The higher stage you get to, the harder the mobs become to kill. When a rift is finally sealed, you get rewards. Most importantly, you get planarite (how much you get depends on the stage you reach). Planarite can be used to buy planar goods, which can help you with battling more rifts or by improving your armor to make you more OP. So far, I've only gotten to level 21 or 22, but I can tell that I will be playing this for a long time.

content:
, 2015
												Pay2Win gear clearance for any gear and appropriate slots have turned me off to this game. You can either pay 900 platinum (a lot) of in game currency for the access, get 100000 void stones for it, (3 weeks worth since theres a weekly cap of 47000 and you gain less than 50 at a time) or you can give Trion 25 dollars for it. (defeating the purpose of F2P)You were supposed to get me, a returning player, back into the game by offering my new features, places to go, and things to do until I hit level 65. By then Id be back into the game enough to where I wouldnt be bothered by something like that. But you cant seriously expect me to instantly dump a bunch of money into something I cant experience at all just on a whim. How am I supposed to get hooked back into the game when the first quest in the game offers me a level 59 quest reward item that REQUIRES THIS CLEARANCE. Right off the effing bat. Im not grinding for 3 weeks for it, nor am I shelling out money for it. And since I dont have that kind of platinum, Im uninstalling this game again for the 3rd time. The first time was before it was even on Steam, the second time was a year ago when I got bored, and this third time is within an hour of playing it again because of the realization that Im instantly behind a money wall as soon as I try to quest in the new area.

												This game is VERY good. The learning curve is much higher than WoW's with many elements of design to progress your character however the main mechanics and interface is very similar. The free-to-play format is quite good even with that element of pay-to-win staring you in the face, though it is not necessary. You may find many hours spilling into this game based on good quest lines and dungeon/raid designs. The community is quite large and finding people to play with in this huge world is never a problem. Many of the player base has in fact played World of Warcraft at some time or still does. The game is power hungry on cpu/gpu so if you got it, be prepared to enjoy some of the best visuals in this MMORPG. Kudos to the Trion team for support and continued design and expansion of this superb title!

content:
y 2
												This is a very fun game. Me and my friends are always online together. There is so much you can do on the game that it doesn't get old. There are always quests to do, instant adventures, and PVP battles. Only complaints I have is that many of the more useful items to buy from the shops are bought with platinum which takes a while to earn. My tip is to play the instant adventures. It is the quickest way that I have found to earn platinum fast. They also have a different currency on the game dedicated to those who have put their own money into it. There are lots of items and such that you cannot buy from the store unless you pay with money. Bummer but its a free game so I expected it in the first place. It doesn't effect the gameplay any and the game is just as fun and addicting whether you decide to put your own money in it or not. Also it doesn't give certain players an advantage over one another just because they use money and not in game currency, which is nice. I have found that trying to get into a PVP warfront is difficult if you are a lower level and i have had wait times to get in to be extremely long. Overall I love the game and I would highly recommend it.

content:
y 13, 2015
												I only recently attached Rift to Steam but I have WELL over 1,000 hours into this game, so I guess I can speak on it.  I do think you can play this game as a F2P game but like anything else if you want the extras then you have to pay - the company has to make a living too.  I personally pay to be a patron monthly and think it's very reasonable and worth it for what you can included.  I would recommend trying the game and seeing what you think and then giving patron's a shot if you like it enough.  I like as much or maybe even more than WoW.  Pros:- Dynamic boss battles.- Fun dungeons and quite a few of them- Very nice graphics.- Always something to work towards and quite different than a lot of the other mmo's out there.  This gives you a great variety of ways to go for leveling your character as well.  - TONS of end of world content!- Very good raid content.- You can transfer to other shards for free.  So, if your friend is in another place, that is fine - just transfer over.  There is also an in-game option that allows you to play with other people who are in other shards without any fuss at all.  This is VERY handy.  Cons:- Sometimes a bit glitchy, but Trion always works it out and makes it up to their customers eventually- PVP is decent but not as good as WoW.- Armor design could be a little better - could use more variety.  But still decent.  - They nickle and dime you on the really nice mounts.  However, you can get a normal mount without having to put real money into it, so it comes down to a vanity thing.  - This game might not be the best for a person who wants to play solo.  There are a lot of almost forced situations in which you really need to group up with people to complete a task.  If you are ok with just randomly grouping and then going your seperate way then you'll be fine.

content:
, 2014
												The few hours I spent playing this game were painstaking. There was absolutely no redeeming factor to the fact that the combat was bland and there was nothing fun about this game. The first class I picked, some sort of stealthy assassin rogue-like class, was apparently so underpowered that it was completely unplayable. It took me 15 minutes to find a friendly player to tell me that that class is practically unplayable because you can't even kill the beginning monsters. I had thought I was doing something wrong. Apparently, the interesting classes need someone to heal them 24/7 and their attacks are weak. The rest of the classes, as far as I could tell, were the generic Warrior/Mage, etc. classes.  Already off to a rough start, I find out there is a subscription (ugh, what is this, Club Penguin?) and that there are also microtransactions and starter packs between $40 and $150.Quite honestly, this game could easily be worse than most RPGs. It's unbalanced classes, money-eating methods, and absolutely NO exciting things about the game leave it to be just another generic piece of crap designed to eat your money. I know this may sound a bit extreme, but without anything to redeem this game from all the bad stuff, what can be said to be good about it?If you're looking for an RPG, try anything but this. Now that I think about it, I think I found more good things in Bad Rats than I did in this game.2/10, generic RPG, don't waste your time

content:
y 7
												RIFT is good. If you need free, and you have a friend that will play this with you, go for it. And when you do, give it a real try the same way you would a paid game. It's easy to shelf a free game if it doesn't feel amazing within 30 minutes. But if you pay $40+ for a game, you usually give it several hours even if it's mediocre.However, if you haven't played Guild Wars 2, you should try that first. It used to be pay once to play forever, but now it's free to play except the expansion (past level 80). GW2 is a lot better than RIFT.So, I guess even though I'm recommending RIFT, it's for a specific group of people: someone that can only play a free game and has played GW2 and TERA and SWTOR so much that he's tired of them.

												Going to say beforehand that I have a lot more hours on Rift then shown, as I played game through ncsoft launcher for most of the time, and only picked up the steamversion when it was on sale.For me Rift was at one Time on of the best MMORPG's out there, even when they went f2p the Game was awesome. Do not get me wrong the Game had problems, for me foremost the Hero engine as your character just does not look smooth when he performs spells/Actions, but that is just a Problem with the Engine in general.However sadly the good Times are gone now or at least for me, the ingame shop has been getting worse and worse and currently I would classify Rift as Pay2Win (not completly p2w yet as you can get pretty muc heverything by grinding too, but the Advantages of the online Shop are destroying your motivation to play this game actively)What also will turn of new players is that you have to spend a stupid amount of Money just to start with all Classes/Souls, as you not only have to buy the expansion but also essential pack. Which is just stupid beyond belief since it hinders anyone new from coming to Rift without spending around 110€. And now to the bigges Problem, Trion, as a Company just gives a ♥♥♥♥ about its customer base/players, and will pretty much ignore any Problem and bugs, and then blame testing Guild for not pointing them out even if they did, this caused pretty much all top end Guild to leave Rift, which a MMORPG needs to have, without the active Hard-Core Community a MMO just isn't as fun.Anyway I would not recomment this  Game for New Players or returning Players, as a beginner you will just have so many Problems and will have to spend so much Money to go to a buggy End Game that it is not worth it, while as returning Player you will just be angry for what  Rift has become.Better remember what it once was, then what Greediness has turned it into.

content:
er 23, 2016
												RIFT!!! Everyone then scrambles to get themselves together , mounting and running across maps and get in on the kills of creatures breaking forth from a portal busting/tearing through reality for epic loot and rewards. Thats this game. A RPG MMO with a style and theme that runs with a very in depth fantastic storyline. The world of Telara is pretty much in ruin by a bad guy sorceror evil evil guy. His names Regulas, charismatic with followers and evil evilness. No one can seem to defeat him and the 2 factions Defiant and Guardains are just as much at war with each other as with Regulas. So with crazy ancient technology that is very artistic and themed throughout this game. Kinda reminds me of Stargate SG-1 stuff, create the ascended with souls and this crazy technology steampunk stuff. Thats you, an ascended and off to character creation and off to the story line of grooming yourself to go back in time to kill Regulas for your faction and save Telara. YAY. Factions of Guardians ( chosen of the gods) or Defiants ( we got this bro) is more of race selection. Guardians have humans, elfs and dwarfs. Defiants have humans, elfs and bahmi. Bahmi are the games created race and seem orcish spiritual brutes. So with that there is classes-Warrior, cleric , mage, rogue. SIMPLE? no. this is where RIFT brings more to the custimizable table. True you have a class, but for each class you choose 3 soul trees out of a large list of souls. Each souls tree brings a very specific playing style, abilities, skills. So mix/match what you want to do as your chosen class with 3 soul trees. There are lots of souls, you can change the souls according to role or gear or w/e AT ANY POINT OF THE GAME. You can definantly be so custimizable with your class its nuts. Its fun. Warrior that has a warrior pet? yes. Rogue with a bow that heals? yes. So with the possibilities endless and the freedom to do it. DO IT. Thus then you play the game, like I said going back in time to prep yourself for the coming battle against Regulas for honor of your faction.  Aspects of the game of equipment and class upgrading is typical of RPGMMOs. Points and better gear and abilities and such while leveling doing quests/missions and grinding. Crafting is about the same of choose what fits your class or what you want to do and do as follows to get better. Armorcrafting, runecrafting, outfitting and such. Fishing and survivialism everyone has and starts off with . They are nice ''food eating health buffs'' and time killing crafting. Higher levels is higher rewards, but harder to craft. Fun and rewarding.  This game has 2 neat little aspects of minnions and demensions. Minnions are little creatures that you collect and send off to do quests to gather stuff ( crafting stuff) for you and level up and Dimensions are little homemade houses and areas you collect decor on  and make your own. These have become the new standerd of RPGMMOs, Rift does fill that void and does a good job implementing their own style and theme into it.  oh and yes, .... RIFTS?! are little portal/tears in reality that element specific creatures do spawn out of, and show up randomly, accessable to anybody and when shut down through waves/stages you get epic gear and loot. trust me, you want in on them whenever/whereever possible. its the game. its fun. RIIIIIFFFFT!!!!!

												Overall I have played many MMO's mainly for the PvP. Ive played played RIFT in BETA and for the first year of its release. Revisiting this game recently as it went F2P I wanted to see what has changed and if the PvP was competitive. The game has no open-world pvp, I couldnt find anyone to fight other than lvl 65's which as a lvl 28 mage would have been suicide to engage. So I was left to que for warfronts that did pop fairly regularly.The class balance in the game is terrible, a decently geared bard will never die. Add to the pay to win store that pretty much means you either smash the other team or you get obliterated. Good, fun, close, tough matches are unicorn rare.For me the game is a terrible choice if you like PvP, if you like PvE I am the wrong person to ask.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
er 23, 2016
												RIFT!!! Everyone then scrambles to get themselves together , mounting and running across maps and get in on the kills of creatures breaking forth from a portal busting/tearing through reality for epic loot and rewards. Thats this game. A RPG MMO with a style and theme that runs with a very in depth fantastic storyline. The world of Telara is pretty much in ruin by a bad guy sorceror evil evil guy. His names Regulas, charismatic with followers and evil evilness. No one can seem to defeat him and the 2 factions Defiant and Guardains are just as much at war with each other as with Regulas. So with crazy ancient technology that is very artistic and themed throughout this game. Kinda reminds me of Stargate SG-1 stuff, create the ascended with souls and this crazy technology steampunk stuff. Thats you, an ascended and off to character creation and off to the story line of grooming yourself to go back in time to kill Regulas for your faction and save Telara. YAY. Factions of Guardians ( chosen of the gods) or Defiants ( we got this bro) is more of race selection. Guardians have humans, elfs and dwarfs. Defiants have humans, elfs and bahmi. Bahmi are the games created race and seem orcish spiritual brutes. So with that there is classes-Warrior, cleric , mage, rogue. SIMPLE? no. this is where RIFT brings more to the custimizable table. True you have a class, but for each class you choose 3 soul trees out of a large list of souls. Each souls tree brings a very specific playing style, abilities, skills. So mix/match what you want to do as your chosen class with 3 soul trees. There are lots of souls, you can change the souls according to role or gear or w/e AT ANY POINT OF THE GAME. You can definantly be so custimizable with your class its nuts. Its fun. Warrior that has a warrior pet? yes. Rogue with a bow that heals? yes. So with the possibilities endless and the freedom to do it. DO IT. Thus then you play the game, like I said going back in time to prep yourself for the coming battle against Regulas for honor of your faction.  Aspects of the game of equipment and class upgrading is typical of RPGMMOs. Points and better gear and abilities and such while leveling doing quests/missions and grinding. Crafting is about the same of choose what fits your class or what you want to do and do as follows to get better. Armorcrafting, runecrafting, outfitting and such. Fishing and survivialism everyone has and starts off with . They are nice ''food eating health buffs'' and time killing crafting. Higher levels is higher rewards, but harder to craft. Fun and rewarding.  This game has 2 neat little aspects of minnions and demensions. Minnions are little creatures that you collect and send off to do quests to gather stuff ( crafting stuff) for you and level up and Dimensions are little homemade houses and areas you collect decor on  and make your own. These have become the new standerd of RPGMMOs, Rift does fill that void and does a good job implementing their own style and theme into it.  oh and yes, .... RIFTS?! are little portal/tears in reality that element specific creatures do spawn out of, and show up randomly, accessable to anybody and when shut down through waves/stages you get epic gear and loot. trust me, you want in on them whenever/whereever possible. its the game. its fun. RIIIIIFFFFT!!!!!

												Personally, i can't reccomend this game. Atleast not to anyone with an average graphics card, or someone who's played things like Fable 3. I was dissapointed in this game, i think. It took me 3 days to download all the patches, all the updates, EVERYTHING. And then i was excited about the character creator, thinking "Oh, this looks like a good game! I'll spend 15 minutes creating a really good looking character and then play the game!"Oh if only i knew.First of all, it controls like a tank. Making A and D move your perspective? NO THANK YOU! I'd rather use the mouse for that!Second of all, CAMERA ANGLES. This game is full of awful camera angles, and when i was being attacked, I COULDN'T EVEN TELL WHERE I WAS GOING!And that's another thing. In the beginning of this game, EVERYONE LOOKS THE SAME. Why bother having Humans on the Defiant side if theres Humans on the Guardian's side AS WELL? And maybe that would be fine if there were mostly demons (Or whatever they're called) On the Defiant side, but NOOO! OF COURSE the defiant side is just FULL of humans! I couldn't even get to the second mission, finding some chick named daria or something, without getting lost and ending up on the Guardian's side, and I couldn't even tell they were Guardians before they started ATTACKING ME FROM ALL SIDES.And lastly, the graphics sucked for me. It might just be my graphics card, or maybe the game is just THAT OLD. But you could have atleast tried to fix it.In the end, all i got out of this game was that the character creator was fun.While it lasted.

content:
ry 15
												A great game for the F2P model with a huge amount of pro's despite many who go "pay to win" and "grindy" (Welcome to an MMO kid.) - Sure there are pay to win options - what Modern MMO doesn't have this? Level Boosts, Exp Boosts etc, for the free-to-player Pro's & Notes.- Like many Player Housing Scemes; there in lies the issue; hooks,  forced placement, in RIFT unlike many it is free to build if you so wish and have the patience; sure the dimension has boundaries, but it does not generally restrict you in too much minus your creativity.- Invastions; Recurring thing, perfect to leap into, Rifts and other such things; a nice addition to the general living feel of the map, and game world.- Good Story; I love RIFT's story, for those who say there is none - explore more.- Crafting; Again I adore the crafting system, simple, easy to use, and generally done well.- Graphics; Though not the Next-Gen type all Milleniel Kids want; the Graphics are still decent overall, sure they may not be -the best- around, but far better than other f2p games of the same genre.- Wide Array Of Content; from Solo, to Group to Raid Group, and generally entertaining on a multiple play-through experience.- NOT A Money Grab; despite many such "Reviews" which are literally one comment venting an opinion like a tool; it is not a money-grab game; unless -you- make it; like the SWTOR-generation of MMO's it offers X thing from a Store, these are optional, (Then again imo as a review is mostly just that, an opinion; these are the types whom claim the game is grindy, again welcome to MMO.)- Guild Questing; a grand system; have seen implimented in things like BDO more recently; just pointing out pretty neat.- Wardrobe System; Anything you have one worn you can cosmetically wear over yourself again; a nice system, and requires nothing more than previously owning an item or weapon. Good for Roleplaying.- The Game Is Not Dead; Though the game may be dead to others whom for one reason or another have left it, it is in fact quite populated.- Ignoring Someone; Ignoring ignores the toons on that person's account widely - in that, no more need to worry about a multi-gold spamm seller, ignore once, ignore them all.Con's & Notes.- Daily & Weekly Quests: Not really a COn but needed something here, A grindy way to get currency" (Welcome again to MMO's.)- The Community: I'm joking once the bad egg's are on ignore it's perfectly fine (Or just don't involve yourself in the 'general chat' nonosense.- Okay this one is a slight..eh gripe more than a con: Invasions can kill quest NPC's...eh slightly annoying if you have horrible timing.- Bad Reviews: The Store Page has 'Bad' Reviews, I do not mean they are all negative, I mean some are just...bad, for the sake of people thinking they are funny, though in their defence, I suppose Children are allowed to own a PC under the age of Twelve these days.That's about it. Overall the game is good full time or casually; a solid 8/10.

y 19, 2015
												Rift called by many a WoW clone is (regardless if it's true or not) a great game. Great F2P Model, good gameplay, goo story and overall very engaging.Like all MMORPGs you start off with a specific combat type, however, unlike many other MMORPG this combat type is highly dynamic offering you countless types of classes.You are set in a world interacting with multiple worlds, in the sense that the world where you do your regular actions is frequently invaded by planar creatures, creating a good atmosphere where regular global events to fend off attackers take place. These events are called rifts  (tears in the fabric of your universe). I'm still in the beginning of this game so I will update this review as I progress through it, but so far I'd highly recommend this game for its fair model, and hell, it's free. Give it a shot!If you are a fan of MMORPG you won't regret downloading it!8.5/10

content:
ry 24, 2015
												   Rift is a fun to play MMO. Especially for a title that had made the move to a free to play game. I think Trion has done well with the store integration and the game it still very playable to the level cap even if you don’t pay for a thing. I have played many MMO titles free and paid and have found Rift to be one of the more enjoyable.    I have seen complaints from others of how Rift has become a pay to win game, they have broken the PVP system or the game is full of bugs. I personally have seen nothing in these regards that would cause me to have any complaint. Yes, the store is full of items and such that I would call “stupid expensive.” I remind myself that the people who buy these items are helping to make the game free and I can just work for something for a bit and still get good and powerful items if I have a little patience. However I did buy one of the expansion packs and felt it was well justified as it had many useful items and I have no subscription to worry about. As for people complaining about PVP all I have to say in response is I suck at PVP so it is broken in every game for me, I am missing nothing on this front, lol. As far as bugs go, I have experienced a few crashes and glitches in the game but no more so than many other games I have played. I have not had a glitch or crash that has caused me anything more than the minor annoyance of waiting for about a minute to get back to doing what I was doing.    Over all I find my experience of Rift to be quite enjoyable. Before starting to play Rift when it became a free to play game I had considered going back to WOW, but I am glad I gave Rift the chance. It is just as much fun, has more story, I die just as much in PVP, and I don’t have to pay costly subscription.

content:
1, 2014
												One of the few games I can keep coming back to, which makes it one of the better MMO's out there.There is so much freedom, character creation wise, you can either go with a pre-made skill tree, or you can put one together yourself, I've found myself to do this more frequently, not one character I make is the same, ever, this keeps it interesting, not to mention I can unlock more if I ever find the desire to spend the money to unlock it with, not yet though, there's still much to explore without spending a dime!I've spent about 10 Euro as I'm writing this, and compared to a lot of the games I've played, time/money ratio is excellent,¨(I am an extremely patient player, so this may vary from person to person) So even if this is a F2P game now, don't be afraid of spending a little cash, unlike some games, what  you buy stays with you, so you don't get screwed over and feel like you're being punished with a "demo" once you quit paying. I'm looking at you, DDO, LoTRO and you other little ninjas hanging out there.One complaint though, it's way too easy, with the group I frequently play with, not even well geared, we can handle dungeons undermanned, we can solo rifts meant for a standard group, it's actually one of the reasons I never play this game longer than a month or two at a time, before having to take a break again, as there's no real challenge, it can't be right that I can tank an entire boss as a mage without getting hurt. I hear this was very different before it became F2P, why it would change for the worse, I don't really understand, mass appeal for the casual gamers out there perhaps?There's a few features that I'd like to see implemented:- Being able to play music, I was once a very loyal LoTRO player, and there was nothing better than freestyling on a lute for me, in my house.- Lotteries, chance to win ingame cash, mounts, pets, cosmetics as long as you sign up from the marketplace perhaps.- Actual challenges, I hate fighting a boss and suddenly seeing 50+ people taking them down in a matter of minutes when it was supposed to be difficult - force their damage to event related bosses, to be lowered perhaps? Anything?Also, it seems to be headed in the direction of WoW, where you can win by simply rolling your head on the keyboard, please don't do that, it's the reason I quit playing that game (back when you could only be level 40 or so).- I'd love to see more races with more unique traits, it doesn't seem like that anything you pick will ever really be more than a simple convenience for you at times, where most of it only functions out of combat, or makes such a little difference that simple looks wins the battle over practicality, and doesn't even deserve a spot on your hotkey bar after you reach up high in the levels.- Fix the auction, I'm at that point in the game where I don't care if I buy one thing for 2 platimum one day, and 32 for the same thing another day, simply because I make so much that money has lost its value to me entirely. There is no sense of consequence about frivelous spending whatsoever.- Progress is too fast and "linear", from the time I started I feel like I could max everything out in no time at all, on top of that, once you've played through the first time, you find yourself rushing things because there's only a few different paths you can take before you've played every single mission and storyline, add a little more factions, areas, rivalry between factions (meaning you won't be loved by everyone in the end, add consequence and critical thinking!!)- Add more variety to the adventures, they stay fun for 5 minutes, then you start seeing the same pattern repeating itself over and over, this makes me quit, repetition is a game killer.All that being said, I enjoy this game more than most, it just needs that little kick to actually keep me in the seat more than what it does, and it's a sure winner in my book.

number of helpful: 8 of 16 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
er 22, 2014
												"Beauty is only skin deep." That is how this game felt like.Seeking for a new MMORPG to play, I saw this game's trailer and was attracted to it. I started to download it and was surprised that it was over 18GB and thought that it must be really awesome. After the download, there was a patch that was over 13GB so I became impatient and was like, "This better be good." Then after gruesome hours of waiting, I was able to enter the character creation (which was unimpressive), and was finally in-game.So first look, the game is visually good (just visually though). I ran around, explored and quested for several hours and this is what I have observed:1.) The game is too passive and lacking- I can't believe this was released in 2011 and it still plays out like an incomplete game today with little to no scenario and AI. It feels like those custom made warcraft maps in the works where only the terrain and units were layed out and has nothing much else to offer. Mobs are just standing all over the place or roaming all over the place with almost no purpose. There are a lot of things you can see and interact with that seems to have no significance at all.2.) Poor mechanics and balance-Special mobs or bosses, don't seem any different from the regular ones, just higher hp. Character's normal attacks are almost negligible, skills suck, your hp goes down almost the same rate as whatever it is your fighting then you regen everything so quickly after being out of combat for some time. Potions felt so irrelevant, you get mobbed by two enemies of same level, you use one, not so much hp recovered and the cooldown is so slow you just die unless you run, good thing the system is so undeveloped that if you just run with low hp you'll survive somehow because all of the nearby mobs just ignore you. They say dynamic battles in their site, but i don't see anything dynamic at all even in their videos.3.) The interface and controls are not so user friendly- This is the first time in my whole gaming history where it took me quite a lot of time to figure out how to navigate and use the interfaces. Equipping, buying, selling, etc. everything was just ugh.. not so convenient and the game heavily relied on right-clicking for no good reason.4.) Unattractive and unamusing character 3D models- For a game that looks so grandiose with a folder size of 37.5GB, it is just so sad that the character model's designs and movement are so mediocre and generic. Aside from the disappointing character creation options, I went in to battle just to find out how lame these models move. I can't believe that I was already using or chaining skills with what I was seeing, as they were not so far off from looking like a normal attack.5.) Lots of features and game elements- This game has a lot of content: multiclass characters, mounts, fishing, crafting, cooking, alchemy, blacksmithing, rifts, bigass bosses, etc. Aside from the visuals, this was the only other good thing about it. The system was just so bad despite being a non-beta game that I spent most of my gaming hours just fishing instead.In conclusion, this game is such a waste. It has a lot of good concepts thrown into it that you just don't see or feel being projected in-game. If they can rework and improve their system, then it can probably be one of those games with ultra large communities that last for years.

												I've been playing WoW on and off since vanilla and with the last expansion I finally just got bored.  I tried Rift when it first came out purely for the graphics which still to the day are phenomenal but I just didnt get into the whole solo ability of the game. content:
ry 19, 2016
												This game does, in my opinion, have lackluster combat, it is not that thrilling. Starting out, it is very slow, it will take awhile to get to the more fun areas. BUT, once you do get those levels and a decent skill tree, you will find a beautiful gem of a mmo. The developers have taken very good care of this game and not turned it into a forced profit based design. The community is active and lively, between guilds, raid battles, and amazing world boss event battles, this game is worth every minute of time it takes to level into the higher areas. Once you are able to get into the lvl50 areas, you will find a world ripe with rich story, colorful and horrifiing landscapes, and creative npc's.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												This game is by far THE BEST mmo experience I have ever had in my life. The client lets you play almost immediately as you start downloading. There is little to no wait at all. The graphics are beautiful. The land is strange and exotic. The characters and classes are cool and less cliche. The map works like a dream. I have absolutely nothing to complain about. The only suggestion I could make is that the user interface allow an option to download the game slowly in the background, about 4KB/sec like Lord of the Rings Online allows in its settings.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
10
												Most underrated MMO.I played Rift in the beta and into launch, as well as over the course of its life (sis years now!). I can hands down say that it is one of the most in depth and engrossing games I've played. The content is rich and plentiful; the class system is my favourite of any MMO that I've played; the maps are well thought out and exciting; the quests are engaging; the player and guild housing system is INSANE; the crafting is intriguing and worthwhile; and maybe best of all, the community is fantastic. Not only is Rift beautiful, but it's fun as hell and very addicting. Love Rift and definitely recommend it!

												RIFT is a GREAT free-to-play MMORPG comparable to World of Warcraft but with several advantages, like many more classes (known as Souls) and of course the lack of subscription.RIFT is clunky in some areas such as animations and hotbar bloating, but most of these issues are minor nuisances rather than a game breaker.For a quick overview of the game, including pros and cons, feel free to check out the video below:http://youtu.be/Fdz1wDGorhY?list=PLklrkLw7j3VRjVPlrlF4tNcvFfmNewO6r

												Fun game.  Invaders attack charge them die.  Respawn charge them and die again.  Respawn.  Repeat until Invaders defeated.  THis game is fun and I see a lot more players online in this than Ido World of Warcraft which is surprising as WoW is supposed to have so many million players.  If you want an MMO that has players online and visible to you no matter what level you are then this is the game.  Ignore all those reviews about play 2 win. You can have fun without spending any money.  Recommended
